AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country of the border patrol agents and location of the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Moore, Texas: location near the border where Interstate 35 passes
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway leading directly to the border and passing through Laredo, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexican border: physical boundary relevant to legality of investigatory stop and location near the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.northbound lanes of Interstate Highway 3: part of the highway where the border patrol agents observed the pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.camper: vehicle used to transport illegal aliens, with a compartment searched for evidence, often heavily loaded and with fogged windows, driven by Maria De Jesus Garcia
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court where the suppression motion was filed and considered
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographical boundary relevant to the case and location of the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: city through which Interstate 35 passes and located near the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate 35: highway leading directly to the border and passing through several towns including Laredo, Texas and Moore, common smuggling route with history of alien smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Moore: location near the border and one of the towns passed by Interstate 35
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.segment of Interstate 35 near Moore, Tex: specific segment of highway known for alien smuggling activity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: federal court that has ruled on cases related to probable cause and searches, including United States v. Pena-Cantu, United States v. Pacheco, and United States v. Orona-Sanchez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pena-Cantu: court case reference where the Allen charge was deemed permissible
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pacheco: court case reference that affirmed the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Orona-Sanchez: court case reference that upheld the use of the modified Allen charge
